title: SUNLIGHT - LITHIUM BATTERIES INVESTMENT
notes:
Location
The project is located in Xanthi, a cohesion (less developed) region in the North-Eastern part of Greece.

Capacity
The nominal manufacturing capacity of the pilot line is up to 200 MWh. However, it's important to note that this pilot plant will not produce any commercial-grade cells.

Investment amounts
The proposed EIB finance for the project is approximately EUR 25 million, while the total cost is estimated to be around EUR 70 million. The project is part of a broader research, development, and innovation (RDI) project aimed at developing and producing complete Li-Ion battery systems, including the cells.

Project progress
As of the latest update, the project has been signed on 31/10/2023. The investment covers the period 2022-2025, and the pilot line and R&D facilities are part of a broader RDI project.

Project type
The project concerns the development of a pilot line to produce prototype Li-Ion cells in a greenfield building adjacent to the current Xanthi manufacturing plant. It is a new build project aimed at developing and producing complete Li-Ion battery systems.

Value chain stages
The project covers the development of prototype Li-Ion cells, indicating involvement in the cell fabrication stage. However, it's important to note that the pilot plant will not produce any commercial-grade cells.

title: Greece: EIB to support innovative battery production with €25 million loan to Sunlight
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Xanthi, northern Greece.

Capacity:
- The project aims to increase the production capacity for lithium batteries and is expected to create 205 new skilled jobs. The company is in the process of transforming itself from a mainly lead-acid battery manufacturer to a provider of energy storage applications and direct supplier of batteries to Original Equipment Manufacturers ("OEMs") for industrial forklifts.

Investment amounts:
- The European Investment Bank (EIB) has confirmed a €25 million, 10-year loan to support the project. This is the second round of EIB support for Sunlight, with the first being a €12.5 million loan agreed in 2018. The financing will contribute to the company’s research, development, and innovation (RDI) activities related to battery development and production.

Project progress:
- The project is in the process of expanding manufacturing capacity and creating new jobs at its state-of-the-art plant in Xanthi, northern Greece. The EIB's financing will support an innovative investment project to increase the production capacity for lithium batteries and expand Research and Development capabilities. The project will also support the development of a pilot line to produce prototype lithium cells.

Project type:
- The project involves expanding the manufacturing capacity at an existing state-of-the-art plant in Xanthi, northern Greece.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the development of a pilot line to produce prototype lithium cells, indicating involvement in the cell fabrication stage of the battery manufacturing value chain.

title: World’s largest battery unit expands
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Xanthi, northeastern Greece, with further expansions of assembly plants in Verona, Italy, and North Carolina, United States.

Capacity:
- The investment will increase the battery manufacturing output capacity to 7GWh annually, with the Xanthi unit’s lead-acid battery capacity increasing from 4GWh to 5.3GWh and the lithium-ion battery assembly capacity adding 1.7GWh annually.

Investment amounts:
- SUNLIGHT has announced a €50m investment plan for infrastructure, machinery, and new production-assembly lines for both lead-acid and lithium-ion technologies. This is in addition to a €105m investment at the Xanthi plant for R&D and prototype production line for lithium cells.

Project progress:
- The expansion of infrastructure with automated, state-of-the-art machinery in the lead-acid battery plant in Xanthi, Greece, and further expansions of assembly plants in Verona, Italy, and North Carolina, United States are underway. The increased production is anticipated to begin by Q3 2022.

Project type:
- The project involves the expansion of existing infrastructure with automated, state-of-the-art machinery for lead-acid and lithium-ion battery production.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly for both lead-acid and lithium-ion batteries. Additionally, SUNLIGHT operates a lead recycling facility, supplying 60% of raw material requirements in lead, aligning with the circular economy business model.
